intro: Cochlidiosperma sublobata, commonly known as the narrow-lobed cockspur, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny pods. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces showy, yellow flowers that attract pollinators. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
